sys_variable_value.value:
{"name":"root","children":[{"name":"results","children":[{"name":"results_object","children":[{"name":"generated_text","children":[],"type":"string","jpath":"$.results[*].generated_text","previewValue":" components and their functions.
SAP ERP architecture components and their functions:
1. SAP ECC (ECC stands for Enterprise Resource Planning): It is the core component of SAP ERP system, responsible for managing all the business operations such as financial management, logistics, human capital management, and supply chain management.
2. SAP DB (Database): It is the database management system that stores and manages all the data of SAP ERP system. It is responsible for data security, data consistency, and data retrieval.
3. SAP APO (Advanced Planning and Optimization): It is a module that helps in planning and optimizing supply chain management, production planning, and distribution planning.
4. SAP BI (Business Intelligence): It is a module that helps in data analysis, reporting, and business intelligence. It provides tools for data visualization, data mining, and data warehousing.
5. SAP CRM (Customer Relationship Management): It is a module that helps in managing customer interactions, sales, and marketing. It provides tools for customer service, call center management, and sales force automation.
6. SAP SCM (Supply Chain Management): It is a module that helps in managing supply chain processes such as sourcing, production planning, and delivery. It provides tools for supply chain visibility, inventory management, and logistics management.
7. SAP SRM (Supplier Relationship Management): It is a module that helps in managing supplier interactions, supplier evaluation, and supplier performance management.
8. SAP HR (Human Capital Management): It is a module that helps in managing employee data, payroll, benefits, and performance management.
9. SAP FI (Financial Management): It is a module that helps in managing financial processes such as accounting, budgeting, and financial reporting.
10. SAP CO (Controlling): It is a module that helps in managing cost accounting, profitability analysis, and financial planning.
11. SAP PS (Project Systems): It is a module that helps in managing project management processes such as project planning, project execution, and project monitoring.
12. SAP QM (Quality Management): It is a module that helps in managing quality control processes such as quality planning, quality assurance, and quality improvement.
13. SAP PM (Plant Maintenance): It is a module that helps in managing plant maintenance processes such as maintenance planning, maintenance execution, and maintenance reporting.
14. SAP CS (Customer Service): It is a module that helps in managing customer service processes such as call center management, service scheduling, and service billing.
15. SAP RE (Real Estate Management): It is a module that helps in managing real estate processes such as property management, lease management, and facility management.

These are some of the main components of SAP ERP architecture and their functions. There are other components as well that cater to specific industry needs such as SAP IS-Retail, SAP IS-Utilities, SAP IS-Oil and Gas, etc."}],"type":"object","jpath":"$.results[*]","previewValue":""}],"type":"array.object","jpath":"$.results[*]","previewValue":""}],"type":"object","jpath":"$","previewValue":""}
